title: I’m a CEO and former Google exec who spent decades in the office. Here’s why I’m conflicted about return to office vs. remote-first
description: Remote work has surprised me in ways I didn’t anticipate. The most significant benefit? Access to a global talent pool.
author: Chris O’Neill
excerpt: Remote work has surprised me in ways I didn’t anticipate. The most significant benefit? Access to a global talent pool.
text: BYChris O’NeillChris O’Neill is the CEO of GrowthLoop and a board director at Gap. His career spans 25-plus years featuring roles as managing director of Google Canada and CEO of Evernote.
